Sentencas: A novel hybrid system fueled with natural gas (NG), consisting of solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC), proton exchange membrane fuel cell (PEMFC) and gas processing (GP) subsystem for H-2 production and purification, is proposed and modeled in this paper.
Titulo: Modeling of a novel SOFC-PEMFC hybrid system coupled with thermal swing adsorption for H2 purification: Parametric and exergy analyses

Sentencas: The combination of water gas shift (WGS) and thermal swing adsorption (TSA) methods is adopted to convert the syngas from the SOFC into H-2 with high purity for subsequent use as a fuel in PEMFC for additional power generation.
Titulo: Modeling of a novel SOFC-PEMFC hybrid system coupled with thermal swing adsorption for H2 purification: Parametric and exergy analyses

Sentencas: The parametric and exergy analyses show that the proposed hybrid system can achieve high energy conversion efficiency of approximately 64% and exergy efficiency of 61%, which are higher than some other fuel cell systems, such as reformer-PEMFC, standalone SOFC, SOFC-engine/gas turbine and SOFC-chemical looping hydrogen production.
Titulo: Modeling of a novel SOFC-PEMFC hybrid system coupled with thermal swing adsorption for H2 purification: Parametric and exergy analyses

Sentencas: The waste heat recovery for driving the TSA reaction and the H-2 recirculation for the PEMFC are found to improve the net electricity efficiency by 3.24% and 6.33%, respectively.
Titulo: Modeling of a novel SOFC-PEMFC hybrid system coupled with thermal swing adsorption for H2 purification: Parametric and exergy analyses

Sentencas: In addition, using TSA method instead of the traditional pressure swing adsorption (PSA) could improve the efficiency of the SOFC-PEMFC hybrid system without increasing the exergy destruction.
Titulo: Modeling of a novel SOFC-PEMFC hybrid system coupled with thermal swing adsorption for H2 purification: Parametric and exergy analyses

Sentencas: These results reveal that the novel hybrid system is a promising energy conversion system with high efficiency.
Titulo: Modeling of a novel SOFC-PEMFC hybrid system coupled with thermal swing adsorption for H2 purification: Parametric and exergy analyses
